And another thing that is peculiar to the dipper, I don't know any other bird that does it, they build their nest directly over the water.
They don't carry the fecal sack away. The youngsters just do it straight out to the nest.
But it goes straight into the water. And that's another deterrent for predators. If they don't find the drop-ins, they don't find the nest.
